00060 /// @ingroup DEC
00061 /// Constant information about an individual generic operand, like an operand template, describing the operand properties. See @ref DEC for API information.
00062 typedef struct XED_DLL_EXPORT xed_operand_s
00063 {
00064     xed_operand_enum_t            _name;
00065     xed_operand_visibility_enum_t _operand_visibility;  // implicit, explicit, suppressed
00066     xed_operand_action_enum_t     _rw;   // read or written
00067     xed_operand_width_enum_t      _oc2;  // width code, could be invalid (then use register name)
00068     xed_operand_type_enum_t       _type; // IMM, IMM_CONST, NT_LOOKU_FN, REG, ERROR
00069     xed_operand_convert_enum_t    _cvt1;  // decoration string 
00070     xed_operand_convert_enum_t    _cvt2;  // decoration string 
00071     xed_operand_convert_enum_t    _cvt3;  // decoration string 
00072     union {
00073         xed_uint32_t              _imm;  // value for some constant immediates
00074         xed_nonterminal_enum_t    _nt;   // for nt_lookup_fn's
00075         xed_reg_enum_t            _reg;  // register name
00076     } _u;
00077 }  xed_operand_t;    
00078 
00079 /// @name xed_inst_t Template Operands Access
00080 //@{ 
00081 /// @ingroup DEC
00082 static XED_INLINE xed_operand_enum_t xed_operand_name(const xed_operand_t* p)  { 
00083     return p->_name; 
00084 }
00085

00087 /// @ingroup DEC
00088 static XED_INLINE xed_operand_visibility_enum_t  xed_operand_operand_visibility( const xed_operand_t* p) { 
00089     return p->_operand_visibility; 
00090 }
00091

00093 /// @ingroup DEC
00094 /// @return The #xed_operand_type_enum_t of the operand template. 
00095 /// This is probably not what you want.

00097     return p->_type; 
00098 }

00103     return p->_oc2;

00109     return p->_u._nt; 
00110 }

00112 /// @ingroup DEC
00113 /// Careful with this one -- use #xed_decoded_inst_get_reg()! This one is
00114 /// probably not what you think it is. It is only used for hard-coded
00115 /// registers implicit in the instruction encoding. Most likely you want to
00116 /// get the #xed_operand_enum_t and then look up the instruction using
00117 /// #xed_decoded_inst_get_reg(). The hard-coded registers are also available
00118 /// that way.
00119 /// @param p  an operand template,  #xed_operand_t.
00120 /// @return  the hard-wired (implicit or suppressed) registers, type #xed_reg_enum_t
00121 static XED_INLINE xed_reg_enum_t xed_operand_reg(const xed_operand_t* p) {
00122     return p->_u._reg;
00123 }
00124 
00125 
00126 
00127 /// @ingroup DEC
00128 /// Careful with this one; See #xed_operand_is_register().
00129 /// @param p  an operand template,  #xed_operand_t.
00130 /// @return 1 if the operand template represents are register-type
00131 /// operand. 
00132 ///
00133 ///  Related functions:
00134 ///   Use #xed_decoded_inst_get_reg() to get the decoded name of /// the
00135 ///   register, #xed_reg_enum_t. Use #xed_operand_is_register() to test
00136 ///   #xed_operand_enum_t names.
00137 static XED_INLINE xed_uint_t xed_operand_template_is_register(const xed_operand_t* p) {
00138     return p->_type == XED_OPERAND_TYPE_NT_LOOKUP_FN || p->_type == XED_OPERAND_TYPE_REG;
00139 }
00140 
00141 /// @ingroup DEC
00142 /// @param p  an operand template,  #xed_operand_t.
00143 /// These operands represent branch displacements, memory displacements and various immediates
00144 static XED_INLINE xed_uint32_t xed_operand_imm(const xed_operand_t* p) {
00145     return p->_u._imm;
00146 }
00147 
00148 /// @ingroup DEC
00149 /// Print the operand p into the buffer buf, of length buflen.
00150 /// @param p  an operand template,  #xed_operand_t.
00151 /// @param buf buffer that gets filled in
00152 /// @param buflen maximum buffer length
00153 XED_DLL_EXPORT void    xed_operand_print(const xed_operand_t* p, char* buf, int buflen);
00154 //@}
00155 /// @name xed_inst_t Template Operand Enum Name Classification
00156 //@{
00157 /// @ingroup DEC
00158 /// Tests the enum for inclusion in XED_OPERAND_REG0 through XED_OPERAND_REG15.
00159 /// @param name the operand name, type #xed_operand_enum_t
00160 /// @return 1 if the operand name is REG0...REG15, 0 otherwise. 
00161 ///
00162 ///Note there are other registers for memory addressing; See
00163 /// #xed_operand_is_memory_addressing_register .
00164 static XED_INLINE xed_uint_t xed_operand_is_register(xed_operand_enum_t name) {
00165     return name >= XED_OPERAND_REG0 && name <= XED_OPERAND_REG15;
00166 }
00167 /// @ingroup DEC
00168 /// Tests the enum for inclusion in XED_OPERAND_{BASE0,BASE1,INDEX,SEG0,SEG1}
00169 /// @param name the operand name, type #xed_operand_enum_t
00170 /// @return 1 if the operand name is for a memory addressing register operand, 0
00171 /// otherwise. See also #xed_operand_is_register .
00172 static XED_INLINE xed_uint_t xed_operand_is_memory_addressing_register(xed_operand_enum_t name) {
00173     return  ( name == XED_OPERAND_BASE0 || 
00174               name == XED_OPERAND_INDEX ||
00175               name == XED_OPERAND_SEG0  ||
00176               name == XED_OPERAND_BASE1 || 
00177               name == XED_OPERAND_SEG1 );
00178 }
00179 
00180 //@}
00181 
00182 /// @name xed_inst_t Template Operand Read/Written
00183 //@{ 
00184 /// @ingroup DEC
00185 /// Returns the raw R/W action. There are many cases for conditional reads
00186 /// and writes.
00187 static XED_INLINE xed_operand_action_enum_t xed_operand_rw(const xed_operand_t* p)  { 
00188     return p->_rw; 
00189 }
00190 
00191 /// @ingroup DEC
00192 /// If the operand is read, including conditional reads
00193 XED_DLL_EXPORT xed_uint_t xed_operand_read(const xed_operand_t* p);
00194 /// @ingroup DEC
00195 /// If the operand is read-only, including conditional reads
00196 XED_DLL_EXPORT xed_uint_t xed_operand_read_only(const xed_operand_t* p);
00197 /// @ingroup DEC
00198 /// If the operand is written, including conditional writes
00199 XED_DLL_EXPORT xed_uint_t xed_operand_written(const xed_operand_t* p);
00200 /// @ingroup DEC
00201 /// If the operand is written-only, including conditional writes
00202 XED_DLL_EXPORT xed_uint_t xed_operand_written_only(const xed_operand_t* p);
00203 /// @ingroup DEC
00204 /// If the operand is read-and-written, conditional reads and conditional writes
00205 XED_DLL_EXPORT xed_uint_t xed_operand_read_and_written(const xed_operand_t* p);
00206 /// @ingroup DEC
00207 /// If the operand has a conditional read (may also write)
00208 XED_DLL_EXPORT xed_uint_t xed_operand_conditional_read(const xed_operand_t* p);
00209 /// @ingroup DEC
00210 /// If the operand has a conditional write (may also read)
00211 XED_DLL_EXPORT xed_uint_t xed_operand_conditional_write(const xed_operand_t* p);
00212 //@}

00216 XED_DLL_GLOBAL extern const  xed_operand_t xed_operand[XED_MAX_OPERAND_TABLE_NODES];

00218 /// @ingroup DEC
00219 /// constant information about a decoded instruction form, including the pointer to the constant operand properties #xed_operand_t for this instruction form.
00220 typedef struct XED_DLL_EXPORT xed_inst_s {
00221 
00222 
00223     // rflags info -- index in to the 2 tables of flags information. 
00224     // If _flag_complex is true, then the data are in the
00225     // xed_flags_complex_table[]. Otherwise, the data are in the
00226     // xed_flags_simple_table[].
00227 
00228     //xed_instruction_fixed_bit_confirmer_fn_t _confirmer;
00229     
00230     // number of operands in the operands array
00231     xed_uint8_t _noperands; 
00232     xed_uint8_t _cpl;  // the nominal CPL for the instruction.
00233     xed_uint16_t _flag_info_index; 
00234 
00235     xed_iform_enum_t _iform_enum;
00236     // index into the xed_operand[] array of xed_operand_t structures
00237     xed_uint32_t _operand_base; 
00238     xed_bool_t  _flag_complex;
00239 
00240     // bit vector of values from the xed_attribute_enum_t
00241     xed_uint64_t _attributes;
00242 }  xed_inst_t;
00243 
00244 /// @name xed_inst_t Template  Instruction Information
00245 //@{ 
00246 /// @ingroup DEC
00247 /// Return the current privilege level (CPL) required for execution, 0 or 3. If the value is zero, then the instruction can only execute in ring 0.
00248 XED_DLL_EXPORT unsigned int xed_inst_cpl(const xed_inst_t* p) ;
00249

00251 //These next few are not doxygen commented because I want people to use the higher
00252 //level interface in xed-decoded-inst.h.

00254     return xed_iform_to_iclass(p->_iform_enum);
00255 }

00258     return xed_iform_to_category(p->_iform_enum);
00259 }

00261 static XED_INLINE xed_extension_enum_t xed_inst_extension(const xed_inst_t* p) {
00262     return xed_iform_to_extension(p->_iform_enum);
00263 }
00264 static XED_INLINE xed_isa_set_enum_t xed_inst_isa_set(const xed_inst_t* p) {

00273 ///@ingroup DEC

00276     return p->_noperands;
00277 }
00278 
00279 ///@ingroup DEC
00280 /// Obtain a pointer to an individual operand
00281 static XED_INLINE const xed_operand_t* xed_inst_operand(const xed_inst_t* p, unsigned int i)    {
00282     xed_assert(i <  p->_noperands);
00283     return &(xed_operand[p->_operand_base + i]);
00284 }

00292 /// @name xed_inst_t Attribute  access
00293 //@{
00294 /// @ingroup DEC
00295 /// Scan for the attribute attr and return 1 if it is found, 0 otherwise.
00296 static XED_INLINE xed_uint32_t xed_inst_get_attribute(const xed_inst_t* p, xed_attribute_enum_t attr) {
00297     if (p->_attributes & (1ULL<<attr)) 
00298         return 1;
00299     return 0;
00300 }
00301 
00302 /// @ingroup DEC
00303 /// Return the attributes bit vector
00304 static XED_INLINE xed_uint64_t xed_inst_get_attributes(const xed_inst_t* p) {
00305     return p->_attributes;
00306 }
00307 /// @ingroup DEC
00308 /// Return the maximum number of defined attributes, independent of any instruction.
00309 XED_DLL_EXPORT unsigned int xed_attribute_max();
00310 
00311 /// @ingroup DEC
00312 /// Return the i'th global attribute in a linear sequence, independent of
00313 /// any instruction. This is used for scanning and printing all attributes.
00314 XED_DLL_EXPORT xed_attribute_enum_t xed_attribute(unsigned int i);
00315 
00316 //@}
